original_title: Norochcholai power plant unit 3 to undergo 100-day shutdown for maintenance: No power cuts expected
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Unit 3 of the Norochcholai power plant in Sri Lanka will be shut down for 100 days from June 13, 2023, for maintenance, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.
According to the state-run utility provider, the Ceylon Electricity Board, Unit 3 will resume operations on September 30, 2023.

However, there will be no power cuts due to the shutdown, according to Minister Wijesekara, as the country has secured the required coal for the season, and the last coal shipment is currently being unloaded at Norochcholai.
“With the 30th cargo of coal currently unloading at Norochcholai, the full coal requirement of CEB for this season will be met,” Wijesekera said in a Twitter message.
“There will be no blackouts or power cuts, as speculated earlier by CEB unions and media reports, due to coal shortages.” (Colombo/May 2023)
